item.title: Afghanistan war: Army chief replaced as Taliban seize more cities
item.description: General Wali Mohammad Ahmadzai has been removed from his post, as insurgents take more cities.

item.title: Afghanistan war: Do the Taliban want to conquer or compromise?
item.description: The BBC speaks to two high profile figures in its chain of command who have very different messages.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Meet Tokyo's youngest Olympic champion
item.description: Japan's Momiji Nishiya won the first womenâ€™s street skateboarding gold in the sport's Olympic debut.

item.title: Michael Spavor: Canadian jailed for 11 years in China on spying charges
item.description: His sentencing is the latest development in a diplomatic spat between the two countries.

item.title: Australian capital Canberra goes into snap lockdown
item.description: The one-week lockdown comes after Canberra recorded its first case of Covid-19 for more than a year.

item.title: Kinnaur: At least 13 dead and dozens trapped in India landslide
item.description: Boulders fall on a Himalayan highway, killing at least 13 people and trapping many more.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Some Australian Olympians face 28-day quarantine
item.description: Some Australians Olympians are having to quarantine for 28 days after returning to their country from Tokyo

item.title: Afghanistan war: Taliban back brutal rule as they strike for power
item.description: Afghanistan's ex-rulers still back brutal punishments, the BBC finds as it goes behind Taliban lines.

item.title: China: Swiss embassy urges media to remove scientist fake news
item.description: A Swiss biologist who had been quoted in Chinese media in recent days did not exist, it said.

item.title: China to ban karaoke songs with 'illegal content'
item.description: Songs that fall under this category include those that endanger national or territorial integrity.

item.title: North Korea leaves hotline with South unanswered during military drills
item.description: Tensions have risen in the Korean peninsula as South Korea and the US hold joint military drills.

item.title: Afghanistan: The people fleeing the north for safety in Kabul
item.description: The Taliban has taken new territories in the north, forcing thousands out of their homes.

item.title: Gurkha veterans on hunger strike outside Downing Street
item.description: Gurkha veterans say they will starve themselves to death if they do not get pensions equal to British soldiers.

item.title: Why South Korean women are reclaiming their short hair
item.description: Thousands proudly show off their short hair after an Olympic athlete is criticised for her haircut.

item.title: Climate change: The IPCC environmental warning India cannot ignore
item.description: It is the world's third largest carbon emitter, but hasn't set a date for becoming carbon neutral.

item.title: 'Smallest baby at birth' home after 13 months in hospital
item.description: Kwek Yu Xuan weighed only 212g - the weight of an apple - when she was born in Singapore last year.

item.title: Why China's climate policy matters to us all
item.description: The global battle against climate change is likely to be won or lost in China.
